bibdata.title: OpenGIS Implementation Specification for Geographic information
Simple feature access
Part 1: Common architecture
OpenGIS Implementation Specification for Geographic information - Simple feature access - Part 1: Common architecture
bibdata.abstract: The OpenGISÂ® Simple Features Interface Standard (SFS) provides a well-defined and common way for applications to store and access feature data in relational or object-relational databases, so that the data can be used to support other applications through a common feature model, data store and information access interface. OpenGIS Simple Features are geospatial features described using vector data elements such as points, lines and polygons.
